Title: Finance Controller
Company: CTY TNHH CỬA TỰ ĐỘNG HÀN QUỐC VI NA
Location: Tan Binh Industrial Zone, Tan Phu, Ho Chi Minh City
Job Description:
6. Job overview :
This role is responsible for finance operations for KAD VN with major focus on general financial tasks. He or she will closely work with BUM of KAD VN and Finance Director of BAEM to deliver financial & operation KPIs as well as drive Factory improvement initiatives and productivity programs.
7. Responsibility:
A. Direct
• Full ownership of general accounting and costing processes.
• Manage month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing processes and prepare monthly operational performance reports, including variance analysis and suggested corrective actions.
• Ensure adequate costing and accounting processes, including standard cost updates, physical inventory verification, periodic cycle counts, CIP and FA physical count, and detecting internal control deficiencies.
• Manage and prepare the annual budget and quarterly forecasts and support the Business Unit Manager in long-term strategic and financial decisions. Evaluate any gaps/shortfalls versus the budget/forecast and suggest corrective actions to ensure that financial targets are achieved.
• Drive finance digitalization/automation projects for the business unit.
• Provide timely insights of costing and P&L variances.
• Ensure compliance with the ASSA ABLOY Accounting policy, Group guidelines, and internal controls throughout the organization.
• Manage the deployment of cost saving and other programs to improve operating performance. Monitor and suggest actions to continuously improve plant productivity.
• Work closely with the purchasing & sourcing team in vendor management to balance sourcing risk and opportunity.
• Ensure that plant quality policy and ERP program are thoroughly implemented in the finance function.
• Prepare business cases for capital expenditure requests through detailed analysis, showcasing the expected sales and/or productivity gains, operational efficiencies and savings. Manage CAPEX budgets to ensure no overspending and follow-up on the outcome versus the business case.
• Provide full support to all internal and external audits, and any other compliance investigations.
• Lead ad-hoc projects as required.
B. Indirect (Managing team members)
• Fund management: remittance/cash disbursement/ERP.
• Salary calculation: overtime pay/sales expenses.
• Corporate card management.
• Banking works.
• Issuing sales receipts/collecting purchase receipts.
• Preparing accounting audit/tax settlement documents.
• Personnel recruitment.
• Insurance reporting.
• Labor contracts.
• Checking financial statements from book-keeping company.
• Preparing accounting closing documents.
• Resolving Vietnamese government licensing and legal issues.
Job Requirements:
• Degree in Finance or Accounting, CPA/CMA preferred or equivalent local professional qualifications
• Experience: Minimum 2-3 years of relevant professional experience. Experience with international manufacturing industry and/or auditing firm is a strong advantage; preferably with Multinational Corporation (MNC) or Big Four.
• Strong corporate finance experience using ERP.
• Familiar with IFRS GAAP, and local statutory requirements.
• Lead with a strong compliance and integrity mindset.
• Good at speaking and writing English.
• Strong leadership skills required to drive and contribute to an environment of continuous improvement. Open and positive attitude.
• Mature operation skills of Microsoft office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word etc.).

Location: 200-202 Ha Huy Tap, KP. Nam Thien III , Tan Phong Ward, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 200-202 Ha Huy Tap, KP. Nam Thien III , Tan Phong Ward, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Main Tasks

Enrolment

- Introduce programs
- Introduce suitable classes (not only one class)
- Arrange trials

Office Tasks

- School policy sending
- Collect Money
- Cash transaction

Preferred

Competencies – skills, knowledge & abilities

Essential

• Demonstrated superior negotiation skills

Title: 3D Design Specialist
Company: CLO Virtual Fashion
Location: 29a Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Da Kao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic 3D Design Specialist for Marvelous Designer to join our Ho Chi Minh office.

Marvelous Designer's 3D Design Specialist focuses on software training and content creation for creator users. As an industry specialist with extensive knowledge of Marvelous Designer, we help users understand how to make more creative artwork with our software and various 3D/CG tools.

As the first member of the Marvelous Designer Team in Ho Chi Minh, this position will engage in a wide range of initiatives to strengthen the user experience, including providing training sessions or relevant content, responding to inquiries, and sharing user feedback with the Development Team.

Anyone eager to collaborate closely with renowned clients and users while innovating in the CG industry should not miss this opportunity to join the team

▶ To Apply
- Must submit your resume in English.
- Must submit your portfolio showcasing your artwork using CG/3D software listed in the requirements
- If a candidate submits insufficient applications, can be rejected without any notification or requested to share them in accordance with a specific guide.

▶ Please note that
- Only shortlisted candidates will be asked to attend the interview process.
- This position requires on-site work at the Ho Chi Minh office.
- A candidate who resides in a place other than Ho Chi Minh or who should move to Ho Chi Minh in time to join.
- Please note that relocation assistance or subsidies will not be provided

Key Responsibilities
• Providing enterprise/academy user training and solution consultation based on each client’s needs and pipeline
• Produce training content or conduct seminars and online streamings to target a variety of users to make it easier for Indian creators to utilize Marvelous Designer
• Responding to users' inquiries and questions related to the usability of the Marvelous Designer
• Set up our own social media platforms and create/release content and events based on analysis of Vietnam user trends
• Collect and analyze client requirements and share them with the global R&D team and each business team of Marvelous Designer
• Collaborate with Marvelous Designer's global team to plan and execute various projects
Job Requirements:
Responsibilities
• More than 3 years of experience as a 3D specialist, 3D generalist, or any related roles in the game, VFX, or animation industry
• Understanding of workflows in the CG works or having knowledge of CG/3D software, including Maya, 3Ds Max, Substance, Blender, and Houdini
• Experience in using Marvelous Designer, applied in at least 1 project
• Bachelor’s degree in relevant role and industry, including graphic design, media creation
• Native proficiency in written and verbal Vietnamese and professional proficiency in written and verbal English
• Tech savvy – As a member of a software/tech company, candidates must quickly adapt to new software and show proficiency with technology
• Agile, with proven ability to work in fast-paced environments and adhere to tight deadlines

Plus if you have
• Ability to use video production tools (Adobe Premiere, Camtasia, etc.)
• Experience in using ZBrush, Unity, or Unreal Engine
• Experience in conducting training on software use
• Knowledge of pattern-making and relevant tools including CLO, Optitex, VStitcher, etc.
